name: BEST WESTERN Premier Queen Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff was very nice, very helpful. Our room was ok, not much of a value, but you get what you pay for. Its a 15-20 minute walk into town, but very close to the train station. Our complaint was the noise. A party started at about 8pm. A big charity event, with band, DJ etc. It started about 8pm, and got louder and louder until I called the desk at 1245 am and was told the party would be over at 1am. We booked this room only the night before our arrival. They must have known there was a problem with putting anyone in this room. The windows were vibating. If we had paid for a party room, it would have been fine. But we were paying for a bedroom to sleep.
reviews.title: Elegant looking older Hotel. For Us, too Noisey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the highest quality hotel I have ever stayed in. Upon arrival we were told by a very polite receptionist that our room was not ready and we would have to wait about another hour. When we came back after that time, the man informed us we had a recieved a complimentary upgrade to an executive suite! What a great start!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: As soon as you walk in the room your attention is drawn to the giant bed, with very looking luxurious covers (and very comfortable to sleep in). The views aren't particularly interesting but that was unimportant for us, I wouldn't want to look out of the window on blustery September days in NW England. The room had all ammenities it stated prior to booking - big TV, coffee maker etc (the latter being built into a sliding drawer/tray which I found impressive).
reviews.title: Disappointing Hotel

reviews.text: I can't comment on other hotel ammenities such as the food because I did not experience any, but the hotel interior was very beautiful. One of the reasons for choosing this hotel was because I know a little about it's history, and it was visited by many well-to-do folk in the 19th Century. This is primarily because of it's location, which is excellent if you have travelled to Chester by train. The building actually has a walkway joining it to the train station, it is that close. We arrived by car however and elected to park in the station carpark rather than the more expensive hotel carpark (which the receptionist actually advised us to do, very helpful!) One downside to this hotel is the cost, as it is rather steep in price I feel for what you get in a room, and I say that after we booked it cheaper through Booking.com! As for proximity to the centre of Chester, this hotel is not ideal and we had to drive to the centre each time. I am sure there will be a bus service however as people will need to get to the train station.
reviews.title: Overpriced and Dirty

reviews.text: Overall, I have to say our experience at this hotel was thoroughly pleasant and I am very happy to have stayed there.
reviews.title: Should have been called the Dump Hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Queen Hotel for two nights with friends from Bath for a wedding. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so special and had a truly great stay from start to finish. The doorman was there to help us with our luggage, reception staff were so friendly - so unusual in this day and age. My room was in the old part of the building but had everything I needed and was clean and comfortable. I went to see one of my friends rooms in the Kings building and that was out of this world - well jealous! The wedding reception itself was the best I've ever been to (and I've been to loads). The food and service were great. Simon, the head waiter, in charge of the wedding was so profesional and friendly. He couldn't do enough for everyone. The party went on late but the staff were friendly til we went to bed at about 4am. We dragged ourselves out of bed just in time for breakfast which is the best hotel breakfast I've had with loads of choice and a glass of fizz. On Sunday there was a jazz band. The hotel has lovely gardens which was unexpected for a city centre hotel. The only slight downside is the charge for parking but I didn't mind too much as everything else was great. Wish I had a reason to return to Chester again soon. Well done Best Western. You have a great hotel there.
reviews.title: Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic

reviews.text: I have recently with a party of 10 other ladies spent a night at this hotel for my hen night.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was really lovely. Three of the rooms we had were in the queen suites which were amazing for £79 for the room. Apparently we were upgraded to these rooms but if you ring to book a room, say that you want a queen suite for the standard room price and if they have one available they will give you that room, that's their hotel policy.
reviews.title: a little disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The queen suites were huge with great views over the courtyard gardens which were lovely.
reviews.title: We love this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very nice which was served with bucks fizz up to 11am which went down well with my hens!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, can't wait to return !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just arrived home from our nights stay at the Queen Hotel.Friendly staff,luxurious surroundings in a beautiful hotel. Lovely garden area,bars and lounges.
reviews.title: Splendid Hotel

reviews.text: Comfy bed, excellent breakfast (shame we could not have stayed longer)
reviews.title: I love this hotel

reviews.text: We booked this Hotel through Lastminute.Com and would use this site again,no problems whatsoever!!
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: May I say our stay in The Queen Hotel, Chester was very pleasant, the staff were friendly and very helpful,beds were comfortable, the food was great, breakfast was yummm.It was a most enjoyable experience, also the rates were very good. We shall be recommending this hotel to our travel agent in New Zealand
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: Our 12 year old daughter was not allowed into the restaurant. We were not offered to set up a credit facility to add items onto our bill. There was no water in the room. No minibar. We were charged £9.00 for a bottle of water from room service.
reviews.title: mmmmmmmmm

reviews.text: Having been impressed with the room I was given at the Queen Hotel on a business trip over a year ago I decided to bring my family here for a few nights in Chester. We booked via lastminute.com and got a really good room only deal in the Queen part of the hotel covering the August bank holiday period.
reviews.title: Better than a B&B but nothing special

reviews.text: However, that's where the good deal ended. The family room we were given (room 302) was difficult to reach - we had to go up to the 2nd floor, walk along a corridor and up another flight of stairs to a small wing of rooms which felt isolated from the rest of the hotel. The room itself was small with a sloping roof but still managed to fit in a double bed together with two single beds either side. The kettle was broken and needed replacing and there was some peeling wallpaper on the walls. You had to stretch to see out of the windows too.
reviews.title: Roman Relaxation

reviews.text: Unlike other reviewers we had no complaints with the reception staff. They were helpful and there were no queues at check-in or when we checked out. My only slight gripe was that the room was not ready for us to occupy until 3pm (we arrived at 1.45pm) so we waited in the Italian gardens (lovely gardens by the way!).
reviews.title: Definitely stay in the Kings Quarter!

reviews.text: The hotel is convenient for the rail station and is only a short walk into the city centre. However, choose your route into the city centre carefully otherwise there is a horrible subway to walk through. Having said that there is a lovely alternative canalside walk.
reviews.title: Kings at the Queens more than 3-star
Don't stay here if you want a decent nights sleep
reviews.text: We stayed on a room only deal so I cannot comment about the breakfast or any meals in the hotel other than to say the prices were expensive. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and in Chester itself which meant we were never hungry. We found a lovely cafe 10 mins walk, in Brook St, which did a huge full english for just £4 complete with toast and coffee. The pub opposite the hotel also did good value breakfasts and meals too.

description: Winner - Chester and Cheshire Large Hotel of the Year 2010. Winner - Cateys Excellence in Customer Service. Free Bar - Sunday to Friday - 5pm to 7pm. Large, plush hotel with a wow around every corner. Recently enjoyed a £20million refurbishment and expansion. Attached to the railway station in Chester city centre. The best breakfast in the city. Brand new, award winning grill room restaurant with the longest cocktail list in Chester.
